title: Why "Super Galaxy" Kindred? Why not "Justicar"?
body:
Here's Kindred
https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1Of9RNGKTyY/Vyjq7GFk-PI/AAAAAAAA6ac/2zLJirpVmCId4fHfq8gU_FfQGpsCKhK_wCLcB/s640/Kindred_Splash_2.jpg

Here's Aatrox
http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/6/6a/Aatrox_JusticarSkin.jpg

Contrast those two to Rumble (or any of the Gurren Lagann designs, from which Super Galaxy got its origin)
http://vignette4.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/8/88/Rumble_SuperGalaxySkin.jpg

Seems to me like this Kindred skin should be a Justicar skin, not Super Galaxy.

replies.body:
It may be the lighting in the splash/pose, but she doesn't much resemble Justicar in game, especially with her particles. 

http://imgur.com/YYPhxcc
It looks more like a Neon Strike though. Not Super Galaxy. I'm not sure where I see the TTGL reference; may I ask for an explanation of it? :/
We took inspiration from several mechy and shonen animes, not just one. :)

Would it be accurate for me to say that Lamb's design seems to be heavily inspired by the Evangelions from Neon Genesis Evangelion? Just the way her physique flows just oozes that Evangelion style of slenderness rather than that of a bulky war machine. Her "face" reminds me a lot of the Gatchaman, particularly the Gatchaman Crowds reboot. Meanwhile, Wolf's design seems to be very reminiscent of the transforming mecha subgenre , as the model is boxy like how a lot of the early transformers were.
That was one of the inspirations! :)

I am seeing some Kill la Kill in the skins what with the stars on their chests and on Shyvana's hands, like the Goku uniforms. Sure not a mecha anime, but many of the same people who made TTGL.
... She? Katey, I thought you were better than that :(
I was specifically referring to lamb in this case, actually. :)
Ugh, don't do that.

Let's be realistic here.

Wolf is nothing, but a fancy particle anyway.

>Lets design a fun unique '2 characters in 1' champion
>and then reduce one of them to a state where they're literally nothing but a glorified projectile!

I think it looks great. The wolf particles are awesome. You guys did a great job.
Oooo can we have a cosmic zac where he looks like the universe with stars in him (basically {{champion:136}}  lol)

Because Wolf is based on the Gunmen from Gurren Lagann.


Now... can someone explain me why Shyvana is called "Super Galaxy", even if she seems more like a Power Ranger than something from Gurren Lagann?

The color scheme might look similar to Justicar Aatrox', but the shape-language is much more _Super Galaxy_. It also seems like it's a very flashy skin, particles-wise.
Because Justicar isn't space-ish-y themed
Another thread that I tend to agree with said it looks more in line with Neon Strike Vi.
I don't see any overt similarities to the Justiciar line.

Why would it be a justicar skin?
Justicar uses a lot of gold(and blue in aatroxs case),but SG kindred is mostly orange.
Aside from that there aren't many similarities especially since SG kindred is clearly a sci-fi skin,while the justicar line is more phantasy-based.
Rumble's is Gurren Lagann, but Kindred's is Evangelion.  They can't draw the inspiration from the same source every single time.
So glad everyone noticed it's basically Neon Strike.
Fizz is definitely Super Galaxy worthy. But why not call the other two Neon Strike and put them with Vi?

No. Just no. 

Justicar Aatrox isn't a robot.
Starforce Kindred.
